column4: Asking again as I got booted:  What does quiet mean in this line in menu.lst?:  # defoptions=quiet splash
how much output it dumps to the screen (which you won't see if splash is on anyway :p)
So if I just remove the splash, and leave the quiet part, save the file, then do -- sudo grub-update --  I should have my splash screen turned off?
if you want to see the 'normal' linux bootup, get rid of quiet as well
Thank you.  That answers it.
I appreciate it.
what kind of computer are you using?
It's an HP Mini 110 netbook.
but the hard disk is a mechanical one
internal recovery drive or something?
palimpsest is showing it as swap space
sorry, I didn't notice the device name
meaning?
it doesn't actually exist
So palimpsest is, basically, not 'seeing' it correctly?
not exactly; the device in /dev exists, but it's not a piece of hardware
Hmm.  My /swap partition is only 199MB.  I'm just wondering what /dev/zram0 is referencing on my disk.
it's _not_ referencing your disk
unless it's part of the netbook's RAM utilisation, or some proprietary win-swap thing HP has in this thing.  I have no clue.
and you'll remain to have no clue so long as you completely ignore what I already said :p
I'm not ignoring you
I'm just *not understanding*.  I follow that it's not a physical device.
